About Me

Hi, my name’s Lisa and I’m a Research Scientist and Computational Biologist based at the Cambridge Centre for Proteomics located at The University of Cambridge, UK.

Projects

github.com/ococrook/bandle

I am authors on several Bioconductor R packages for Spatial Proteomics data analysis and have been working at the Cambridge Centre for Proteomics since November 2010.

Experience

Research Scientist

November 2010 - Present

https://proteomics.bio.cam.ac.uk

Spatial proteomics data analysis, machine learning, R programmer, Bioconductor package developer

Education

University of Essex

PhD Computational Chemistry/Biology

2006 - 2010

Funded BBSRC CASE (Collaborative Awards in Science and Engineering) Award project under the supervision of Prof. Chris Reynolds (Dept. of Biological Sciences, University of Essex) and Dr. Ian Wall (GSK, Harlow). My main research focused on structure-based drug-design in which I used molecular modelling and molecular dynamics simulation techniques to gain an insight into the structural and functional properties of GPCRs in their multiple states.

University of Essex

BSc (Hons) Mathematics (1st Class)

2003-2006
